intro: Eschscholzia asprella, commonly known as the rough bush poppy, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and bright orange to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Eschscholzia asprella is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppy species.
